articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets 23rd AU Summit
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets 23rd AU Summit
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greeting to the 23rd Ordinary Session of the Assembly of Heads of State and Government of the African Union opening in Equatorial Guinea.
					 Kim in his message extended warm congratulations to heads of state and government and delegates to the assembly on behalf of the DPRK government.
					
					 He expressed belief that shining success would be made in the assembly to  discuss and decide on  the practical issues arising in achieving peace, security and socio-economic development on the continent with "Agriculture and food security in Africa" as its  main agenda thanks to high enthusiasm of all participants.
					
					 Reiterating the DPRK's firm stand to steadily boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the African Union and its member states, the message sincerely hoped that the assembly would serve as an important occasion in promoting the prosperity and steady development of Africa.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Grand Duke of Luxembourg
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Grand Duke of Luxembourg
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greeting to Grand Duc Henri, grand duke of Luxembourg, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would develop on good terms and wished the people of Luxembourg prosperity.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Makes Field Survey of Taean Heavy Machine Complex
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Makes Field Survey of Taean Heavy Machine Complex
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the Taean Heavy Machine Complex.
					 He looked round various production processes to learn about the technical specifications of custom-built equipment and their processing and assembling. Then he held a consultative meeting. 
					
					 It discussed issues arising in increasing the production of custom-built equipment and improving their performance.
					
					 Meanwhile, he went round the construction site of a mushroom farm and consulted a measure for hastening the construction.
					
					 Touring various areas of South Hwanghae Province, he highlighted the importance of preventing the drought.

articles.title: Raul Castro Ruz Supports Korean People's Just Cause
articles.content:
Raul Castro Ruz Supports Korean People's Just Cause
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- The Cuban people will as ever invariably and positively support and encourage the Korean people in their just struggle.
					 Raul Castro Ruz, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, said this on June 14 when meeting with Kim Hak Chol, DPRK ambassador to Peru who was heading the DPRK delegation to the Group-77 Summit held in Bolivia.
					
					 The party, government and people of Cuba are thankful to the party, government and people of the DPRK for having invariably supported and encouraged the Cuban revolution, the president noted.
					
					 The president asked the ambassador to convey the warm greetings of the Cuban people to the Korean people.

articles.title: British Delegation Here
articles.content:
British Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- A British delegation of the Royal United Services Institute for Defence and Security Studies headed by Research Director Malcolm Gorge Chalmers arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: Indignation Meeting of Workers, Trade Union Members Held
articles.content:
Indignation Meeting of Workers, Trade Union Members Held
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Workers and members of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK) held an indignation meeting at the compound of the National House of Class Education on Monday on the occasion of the June 25, the day of struggle against U.S. imperialism.
					 Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the Central Committee of the GFTUK, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that the U.S. imperialists, the sworn enemies, provoked the brigandish war of aggression on June 25, Juche 39 (1950) and inflicted the monstrous calamities and misfortune on the Korean nation.
					
					 Under the leadership of Generalissimo Kim Il Sung the servicepersons and people of the DPRK honorably defended the national sovereignty and gains of the revolution and made the U.S. imperialists go downhill for the first time in history, they noted, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggressors have not yet drawn a due lesson from the defeat in the Korean war but imposed unbearable misfortune and pain on the Korean nation, occupying south Korea. 
					
					 They called for remaining loyal to the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un and giving fullest play to the heroic stamina of the working class of Songun Korea in reunifying the country and achieving the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 Present at the meeting were officials and members of the GFTUK and workers.

articles.title: Officials and Members of DWUK Start Study Tour of Revolutionary Battle Sites in Area of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Officials and Members of DWUK Start Study Tour of Revolutionary Battle Sites in Area of Mt. Paektu
 Hyesan, June 23 (KCNA) -- Officials and members of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) across the country started the study tour of revolutionary battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu.
					 A ceremony of kicking off the study tour took place before the Monument to the Victorious Battle of Pochonbo in Hyesan City, Ryanggang Province on Monday.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket and flowers before the statue of President Kim Il Sung and paid tribute to him.
					
					 A report was made by Kim Myong Suk, vice-chairwoman of the Central Committee of the DWUK, at the ceremony to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that the study tour would be made on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 They called on its participants to learn from the transparent spirit of devotedly defending the leader displayed by the anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters and become passionate women revolutionaries intensely loyal to Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 At the end of the ceremony, they started for Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: Concert Given by Officials and Members of DWUK
articles.content:
Concert Given by Officials and Members of DWUK
 Sinchon, June 23 (KCNA) -- A concert "Deal heavy blow to the U.S. imperialists!" was given by officials and members of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) at the Pamnamu-gol (chestnut valley) of Wonam-ri, Sinchon County, South Hwanghae Province on Monday to take revenge on the U.S. imperialists on the occasion of June 25, the day of struggle against U.S. imperialism.
					 In solo "Our Beautiful Country" and poem "June 25" the performers severely denounced the U.S. imperialists, the sworn enemy, who had ignited a war to deprive the Korean people from the cradle of their lives decades ago.
					
					 Solo "Love to My Homeland and Hatred to the Enemy" and chorus "Peace Is Guaranteed by Our Arms" instilled again into the participants the immovable truth that any mercy should not be shown to the class enemies and the genuine peace should be defended by dint of the arms of Songun.
					
					 In chorus "We Know Nobody but You" the performers represented the intense loyalty and high revolutionary enthusiasm of the Korean people to bring earlier the final victory, united close around supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the DWUK, Pak Thae Sop, secretary of the South Hwanghae Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials concerned and members of the women's union in Sinchon County.

articles.title: Korean Schoolchildren Gives Art Performances in Denmark
articles.content:
Korean Schoolchildren Gives Art Performances in Denmark
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- A small art group of schoolchildren of the DPRK gave performances in Copenhagen and other places of Denmark. 
					 Put on the stage were chorus "Ode to the Motherland", chorus "Joy of the People", instrumental ensemble "We Are the Happiest in the World", kayagum solo "Pyongyang Nalpharam", dance "A Cowboy and a Girl" and Danish songs. 
					
					 The performers made a vivid and artistic representation of the bright looks of the children to be acclaimed by the audience. 
					
					 Many people highly praised the art group for its successful performances.

articles.title: Second Premier Soccer Matches Kick off
articles.content:
Second Premier Soccer Matches Kick off
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- The second premier soccer matches of the Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize started here on Monday.
					 Ten men and women's football teams will play the matches to take place at the Kim Il Sung Stadium and the Sosan Football Stadium from June 23 to July 6.
					
					 Divided into two groups, they will play league matches.
					
					 Two best teams from each group will compete with each other and winners will play finals.
					
					 Standings of remaining teams will be decided by the results of matches.
					
					 Today witnessed men's football matches between the Pyongyang and Wolmido teams and between the Sonbong and Kigwancha teams at the Kim Il Sung Stadium.
					
					 The Pyongyang Team beat the Wolmido Team 3:1 while the Sonbong and Kigwancha teams played a scoreless game.
					
					 The matches go on.

articles.title: People Turn Out in Campaign to Combat Drought in DPRK
articles.content:
People Turn Out in Campaign to Combat Drought in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Many parts of the DPRK have been suffered from a long spell of drought.
					 No rainfall has been witnessed in most areas of North and South Hwanghae provinces, Kaesong City and Kangwon Province.
					
					 According to data available, tens of thousands of hectares of farmland were damaged by drought.
					
					 In this regard, Sok Ji Dong, a deputy director of the Ministry of Agriculture, told KCNA:
					
					 Streams and reservoirs are getting dry for a long spell of drought.
					
					 The drought severely damaged North and South Hwanghae provinces and Kaesong City.
					
					 Servicepersons, workers, officials and housewives have turned out in the campaign to overcome the drought, along with farmers. All necessary means like tractors, trucks, sprinklers and moveable water pumps have been mobilized.
					
					 Meanwhile, it has been pushed forward to find out water resources and protect water resources.
					
					 Special attention is paid to managing waterways in a creditable manner.
					
					 Ministries and national institutions also joined the campaign to combat the drought, sending to co-op farms necessary equipment.

articles.title: Kwangmyong LED Lamp and Solar Battery Factory
articles.content:
Kwangmyong LED Lamp and Solar Battery Factory
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- The Kwangmyong LED Lamp and Solar Battery Factory, built in the outskirts of Pyongyang, has begun operation.
					 The factory is all powered by wind, solar heat and geotherm. It is also perfect from the architectural and formative points of view.
					
					 It has several computerized assembly lines with an integral system of research, production, technical service and sale.
					
					 It is producing scores of kinds of LED lamps in accordance with the standards recommended by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO).
					
					 The institute of the factory is paying its primary attention to manufacturing all its products with locally available materials, while channeling efforts to the development of third-generation solar battery.

articles.title: News Analyst on Park Geun Hye's Designation of Pro-Japanese Elements as S. Korean Prime Minister and Defense Minister
articles.content:
News Analyst on Park Geun Hye's Designation of Pro-Japanese Elements as S. Korean Prime Minister and Defense Minister
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, Park Geun Hye of south Korea designated former chief editor of Choongang Ilbo Mun Chang Guk as a candidate for the puppet prime minister and Han Min Gu as a candidate for the puppet minister of Defense.
					 In this regard, Rim Kwang Chol, a researcher of Kim Il Sung University, told KCNA on June 23:
					
					 Her designation has plunged the whole of south Korea into a "political upheaval".
					
					 Mun has been criticized as a pro-Japanese traitor and Han Min Gu a die-hard confrontation maniacs even in south Korea. 
					
					 In the past, Mun let loose a sophism that the military occupation of Korea by the Japanese imperialists and the June 25 Korean war were the "will of the God", adding it is a blessing for south Korea to neighbor Japan and the Korean nation is "lazy and lacks self-dependence".  
					
					 He even went the length of describing the north-south cooperation as "drain on resources for the north", calling for introducing to south Korea the U.S. tactical nuclear weapons to cope with the DPRK's self-defensive armed forces.
					
					 Therefore, south Korean politicians from ruling and opposition parties are urging Park to cancel the designation. The victims of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army denounced Park for appointing Mun as prime minister of south Korea.
					
					 Han Min Gu is a descendant of a pro-Japanese traitor. 
					
					His grandfather was a turncoat who denounced a chief of volunteers' army to the Japanese imperialist police and helped them to arrest him after capitulating to the Japanese imperialists. 
					
					 Such riff-raffs as Mun and Han have nowhere to go but the dust bin of the history. 
					
					 Park and her group would be well advised to bear in mind that their despicable acts against the nation will only bring earlier their self-destruction.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts Japan's Denial of History
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts Japan's Denial of History 
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government made public a report on the "results of a review" of the 1993 Kono statement in which he admitted the coercion involved in the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army. 
					 Reading the face of the international community, Japan refrained from formally denying the Kono statement, claiming that it was a diplomatic mistake in the past and the like. However, Japan went the lengths of announcing the report on the "results of review" recently. This was a clear revelation of Japan's wrong view on history. 
					
					 The sexual slavery enforced by the Japanese imperialists was a hideous crime against humanity unprecedented in history and it, therefore, can hardly be written off no matter how persistently Japan may deny it. 
					
					 The Japanese imperialists forcibly drafted, lured and abducted 200 000 Korean women and many women of different other countries as sexual slaves to gratify the carnal desire of their soldiers. This crime was unprecedented in the war history.
					
					 The gravity of the sexual slavery was that it was committed by the Japanese military in an organized manner with the government involved. 
					
					 The Japanese imperialists regarded it as one of the important jobs of the military authorities to provide soldiers with "sexual comfort" as a measure for raising the combat spirit of the aggressors and set up even a department for handling the issue after igniting the Pacific War. 
					
					 As a result, a "comfort station" management system was established from the upper echelon to the lowest units of the Imperial Japanese Army and sexual slavery was enforced by it under its unified control and supervision.
					
					 As the Sino-Japan War dragged on and areas under the Japanese troops' occupation expanded, the Japanese military saw to it that all the problems related to the sexual slavery were settled under its direction.
					
					 The Japanese military directly provided the units stationed in the relevant areas with funds necessary for drafting and transporting sexual slaves and their passage and transport to the areas concerned were directly arranged by it or conducted under its supervision. 
					
					 During the Pacific War the head of the Japanese government concurrently held the post of "supreme commander of the armed forces." This was undeniable evidence proving that the government was directly involved in the above-said sexual slavery. 
					
					 This being a hard fact, Japan is persistently distorting and denying the sexual slavery. But this will only invite international isolation and political frustration. 
					
					 International public had already warned Japan that its moves to deny the Kono statement would bring self-destruction to Japan, holding that its act of tearing off the pages of the blood-stained history would not help write off the evils perpetrated by it in the past. 
					
					 If the present Japanese government fails to rectify its wrongdoings in the past, the responsibility for them will rest with the next generation. 
					
					 Japan should face up to the trend of the times and stop at once the moves to distort and deny the Kono statement.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Ridicules Special-Class Traitor's Political Chicanery
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Ridicules Special-Class Traitor's Political Chicanery
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Mun Chang Guk, special-class traitor in south Korea, is coming under ever-growing criticism for his despicable true colors.
					 He let loose sophism before media persons on June 19 that he "respects martyr An Jung Gun and Mr. An Chang Ho and he feels painful when hearing accusations of him as a pro-Japanese element". He even showed his articles written in the past in an attempt to find an excuse for criticism.
					
					 His behavior cannot but stun all the people.
					
					 He is a pro-Japanese lackey without an equal in the world as he let loose every day a whole string of such outbursts as claiming that the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and national division were according to the "providence of the God" and "there is no need to get apology for the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army" and the like.
					
					 All the articles written by him were so traitorous in their contents that everybody cannot but suspect him as a spokesman for Japan.
					
					 No wonder, even the floor leader of the Democratic Alliance for New Politics said he could hardly discern whether Mun is a "candidate for the prime minister of south Korea or an official of the government-general in Korea during the rule of the Japanese imperialists." Even heavyweights of the "Saenuri Party" questioned "whether he is a south Korean."
					
					 In the wake of the designation of him  as a candidate for the puppet prime minister, Mun cried out for taking a strong  legal measure against the media organization which edited and reported a video censuring him, refusing to make any apology.
					
					 Then why is he now getting so busy excusing himself all of a sudden? This is nothing but a cynical ploy to calm down the evermore angry public and get the premiership at any cost.
					
					 He jabbered "what he lectured might sound a little different from ordinary people's sentiments as his lecture was given for believers at such particular place as church" and "it was regretful that there was a reason for misunderstanding." What he uttered was disgusting, indeed.
					
					 All the more ridiculous was his sophism that "he was sorry for causing the people to feel uncomfortable against his will" and "he could hardly understand that his remarks were censured as traitorous ones".
					
					 Commenting on such disgraceful behavior of Mun, the south Korean newspaper Hangyore said: "Had he lectured at a common place, not a church, would he have made a U turn by describing the Korean nation as a hardworking one strong in the sense of independence? Explicitly speaking, what he uttered was so clear that it left no reason for any misunderstanding."
					
					 Mun Chang Guk is a wicked traitor who had already completely betrayed the soul and spirit of Korea and pro-Japanese lackey putting Ri Wan Yong, one of the five traitors of 1905, into the shade.
					
					 Mun's desperate bid to disguise himself as a member of the nation after throwing away his mask as a pro-Japanese element is another insult to the Korean nation and an unpardonable crime.
					
					 By origin, Mun is a stupid trickster and like a seasonal bird as he has neither political career nor political philosophy.
					
					 He is no more than a servant of those in power and hack writer who has an inveterate habit of kowtowing to the conservative forces to make his ends meet, to say nothing of the qualifications as a media man.
					
					 At a forum entitled "For regime change" during the "presidential election" in 2007 he called on the "Grand National Party" (GNP) to focus efforts on the seizure of power rather than on the selection of candidate, grumbling that the GNP is keen on this selection though  "President" Roh Moo Hyun interferes in the election. When Lee Myung Bak was set to come to power, Mun pointed an accusing finger at Park Geun Hye who was the former representative of the GNP before any others.
					
					 But when Park was elected "president" in 2011, Mun made a U turn in his behavior and lavished his praises on the "yusin princess," trumpeting that the God appeared in the history like a defending angel in a fairy tale to protect south Korea.
					
					  In order to please Park, Mun held the post of director of the Memorial Council for Park Chung-Hee when Kim Ki Chun, presidential chief of staff of Chongwadae, who is called de facto vice-president, was acting the first managing director of the council.
					
					 He is a political imbecile and bete noire having neither elementary reason nor faith as he has no principle in his behavior.
					
					 It is hard to predict what a deplorable political position the tight-cornered Park Geun Hye group will find itself when Mun is given the post of the puppet prime minister.

articles.title: South Korean Organization Accuses Japan of Its Moves to Deny Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
South Korean Organization Accuses Japan of Its Moves to Deny Its Past Crimes
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- The movement for reunified Korean nation in south Korea on June 20 released a commentary lashing out at the Japanese authorities' shameless acts.
					 The chief Cabinet secretary of Japan talked about review of the 1993 Kono statement and released a report on the results of a review of the statement on June 20, the commentary noted, and continued:
					
					 In this report Japan made an absurd assertion that the statement was worked out after adjusting wordings between Japan and south Korea.
					
					 In other words, the contents of the statement did not reflect the real intention of the Japanese authorities at that time and there was no choice but to use expressions admitting the responsibility for the sexual slavery, a bid to mislead the public opinion.
					
					 Finding fault with and nullifying the statement is little short of an effort not to admit its past crimes.
					
					 Japan should bear in mind that its honest apology and reparation for its past crimes are the only way of settling its inglorious past.

articles.title: Korean War Caused by U.S. Ambition for Domination over Korea
articles.content:
Korean War Caused by U.S. Ambition for Domination over Korea
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- The Korean War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953) was a war of aggression unleashed by the U.S. to dominate the Korean Peninsula and enslave the Korean nation.
					 The U.S., keenly aware of the strategic importance of geo-political position of the Korean Peninsula in its scenario for invading Asia, has thrust its aggressive claws into Korea already more than 100 years ago.
					
					 In 1945 after the end of the Second World War, the U.S. landed its troops in the southern half of Korea under the guise of "liberator" on the plea of "disarming" the Imperial Japanese Army.
					
					 After reducing south Korea to its colony politically, economically and militarily dependent on it through the organization of pro-American puppet government, the U.S. pushed ahead with preparations for a war against the DPRK on a full scale.
					
					 It put spurs to strengthening the south Korean puppet army, offering to south Korea military aid worth of 1 billion U.S. dollars and shipping into it a large quantity of military hardware. It also deployed huge forces of the puppet army in the forward area along the 38th parallel, while bringing aircraft carriers and strategic bombers into the area around the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The above-said facts can be proved through the book "American Modern History" published in the U.S., which recalls that America started the Korean war with full preparations for the first time in its war history.
					
					 Based on such preparations, the U.S. ignited a war of aggression against the DPRK on June 25, 1950.
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. and the south Korean conservative puppet group have been resorting to every possible means to cover up the truth behind the outbreak of the Korean war. But they can never evade the responsibility for provoking the Korean war as the truth is sure to be brought to light.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work off Press in Cambodia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work off Press in Cambodia
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution" was brought out in booklet by the Antri Miek Publishing House of Cambodia.
					 The talks, published on August 25, Juche 102 (2013), deals with the Songun revolutionary leadership feats of Kim Jong Il and clarifies the essence and originality of the Songun revolutionary idea and the tasks to successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Songun.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded Abroad
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- There took place abroad from June 14 to 16 events commemorating the 20th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's demise.
					 They included a remembrance meeting and a book and photo exhibition held in Italy and Brazil, a seminar in Ethiopia and a lecture in Thailand.
					
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos documenting feats of the President, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display were works of the peerless great men of Mt. Paektu and books and photos on the drive of the service personnel and people of the DPRK for building a thriving nation.
					
					 The chairman of an Italian committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung said that the President is the founder of socialist Korea who freed the Korean people from the yoke of colonial slavery of the Japanese imperialists and developed the DPRK into the best country centered on the popular masses in the world.
					
					 The chief of the Italy-DPRK Association for Friendship and Solidarity paid highest tribute to Kim Il Sung, the eternal President of the DPRK.
					
					 The vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil praised the noble revolutionary career of the President characterized by his total dedication to the sacred cause for his country and people all his life.
					
					 The chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand and other speakers said that the President fathered the Juche idea and the Songun idea, thus providing the guidelines for accomplishing the human cause of independence and successfully applying it to the revolution and construction.
					
					 The President is always remembered by the world progressives desirous of independence as the sun of Juche, they added.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in India
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in India
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- An Indian Committee for Remembering President Kim Il Sung was formed in New Delhi on June 17.
					 The general secretary of the Indian National Congress Party was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and feats of the President on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Lauded by Personage of India
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lauded by Personage of India
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung is the symbol of the DPRK and a prominent great man lauded by the world progressives.
					 Suneet Chopra, member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) who doubles as secretary general of the All India Indo-Korean Friendship Association, said this at an inaugural ceremony of the Indian Committee for Remembering President Kim Il Sung held in New Delhi on June 17.
					
					 The august name of Kim Il Sung will always go down in the human history along with the DPRK, said the secretary general, adding:
					
					 His revolutionary cause was successfully carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il and the DPRK demonstrated its might before the whole world as Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea.
					
					 The DPRK is demonstrating its dignity and might and the Korean people are making shining successes in the building of a thriving socialist nation under the wise leadership of HE Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The cause of Kim Il Sung is sure to triumph and the future of the DPRK is rosy.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised Abroad
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- There took place seminars on exploits of leader Kim Jong Il in South Africa, Romania and India from June 6 to 12 on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of his start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Displayed at the venues of the seminars were photos documenting the exploits of Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display were works of Kim Jong Il and books and photos showing the true picture of the DPRK.
					
					 Garth Lawrence Shelton, chairman of the South African Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said the socialist idea is becoming a steadfast one in the DPRK, adding it is because the idea is based on the Juche idea and the Songun idea the vitality of which has been fully proved since they were founded by President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 B. C. Gupta, chairman of the Delhi Juche Idea Study Society of India, said Kim Jong Il built the WPK as the party of Kim Il Sung, its founder, and developed it into a powerful political force steering the revolutionary cause of Songun.

articles.title: Serbian Political Party Leader Supports June 15 North-South Declaration
articles.content:
Serbian Political Party Leader Supports June 15 North-South Declaration
 Pyongyang, June 23 (KCNA) -- Batric Mijovic, general secretary of the New Yugoslav Communist Party of Serbia, released a statement on June 16 on the occasion of the 14th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The publication of the declaration was of great significance in the movement of the Korean people for national reunification, the stastement said, adding:
					
					 The historic declaration was a valuable fruition of the noble patriotic will and wise guidance of leader Kim Jong Il who regarded the country's reunification as his lifetime mission.
					
					 After the publication of the declaration the reunions of separated families and relatives from the north and the south were held and brisk multi-faceted visits, contacts and economic cooperation took place between the north and the south, bringing a bright hope for reunification to all Koreans.
					
					 However, no sooner had the Lee Myung Bak and Park Geun Hye groups of south Korea taken office than they let loose anti-reunification sophism in total denial of the declaration, again driving the inter-Korean relations to the phase of confrontation and antagonism.
					
					 A touch-and-go situation is prevailing on the Korean peninsula owing to the moves of confrontation with compatriots in the north being perpetrated by the south Korean authorities against the national reconciliation, unity and reunification and the U.S. moves to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 We fully support the joint declaration, regarding it as the most reasonable and practical way for achieving the independent reunification of Korea as early as possible and ensuring peace and stability on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					 We call on all peace-loving people of the world to positively support the just struggle of the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam saluda la XXIII Cumbre de la Union Africana
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam saluda la XXIII Cumbre de la Union Africana 
Pyongyang, 23 de junio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 23 un mensaje de felicitacion a la XXIII Cumbre de la Union Africana a inaugurarse en Guinea Ecuatorial. 
					En nombre del gobierno de la RPDC, el remitente envio calurosas felicitaciones a los jefes de Estado y gobierno y delegados a la reunion. 
					
					Expreso la conviccion de que gracias al entusiasmo de todos los participantes, alcanzara excelente resultado la presente Cumbre que discutira los asuntos practicos para lograr la paz, la seguridad y el desarrollo socioeconomico del continente bajo la agenda de "Seguridad agricola y alimentaria en Africa". 
					
					Reafirmando la firme posicion del gobierno de la RPDC de fortalecer de continuo las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con la UA y sus miembros, deseo de todo corazon que la Cumbre marque un hito importante para promover la prosperidad y el desarrollo sostenido de Africa.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju averigua en terreno el estado del Complejo de Maquinaria Pesada de Taean
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju averigua en terreno el estado del Complejo de Maquinaria Pesada de Taean
Pyongyang, 23 de junio (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, se entero en el terreno de las gestiones del Complejo de Maquinaria Pesada de Taean.
					En su recorrido por varios procesos de produccion, se cercioro de las especificaciones tecnicas de los equipos encargados y el estado de elaboracion y montaje de los mismos y convoco la reunion consultiva.
					
					Se discutieron en la ocasion los asuntos para aumentar la produccion de equipos y mejorar su funcionamiento.
					
					Por otra parte, el premier averiguo como marcha la construccion de la fabrica de hongos y discutio las medidas para acelerar esta obra.
					
					En su recorrido por varias zonas de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, resalto la importancia del combate a la sequia.

articles.title: MINREX rechaza difamacion anti-RPDC de canciller australiano
articles.content:
MINREX rechaza difamacion anti-RPDC de canciller australiano
Pyongyang, 23 de junio (ACNC) -- En exclusiva con la ACNC concedida en relacion con la reciente acusacion del ministro australiano de Relaciones Exteriores. contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del MINREX de la RPDC dio la siguiente respuesta:
					En una entrevista telefonica del pasado dia 19, el canciller australino calumnio atrevidamente hasta la maxima dignidad de la RPDC, al cabo de criticar la justa linea y politica de la RPDC, inclusive el incremento del disuasivo nuclear para la autodefensa.
					
					Es ridiculo que el canciller de un pais haya criticado a otro pais y dicho sin escrupulos las palabras con caracter intervencionista en asuntos internos ajenos, sin conocer los elementales principios de la Carta de la ONU siquiera ni la esencia del problema de paz y seguridad de la region.
					
					La amenaza a la paz y la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana y la region proviene de Estados Unidos que tras ubicar en el Sur de Corea muchas fuerzas agresoras y armamentos mortiferos, desarrolla sin cesar junto con los titeres surcoreanos los ejercicios militares conjuntos tomando como objetivo principal la "ocupacion de Pyongyang". Este hecho es reconocido por todos los hombres juiciosos.
					
					Lo que causa mas consternacion es que el canciller australiano ofendio la maxima dignidad de la RPDC mencionando la supuesta legitimidad.
					
					El no puede abogar por la legitimidad porque sin tener la correcta politica exterior ni criterio propio, repite como papagayo lo que dicen otros actuando como lacayo que ejecuta la politica hostil anti-RPDC de EE.UU.
					
					La RPDC no perdonara ni un comino a los que se atrevan a insultar su maxima dignidad y les hara frente rotundo.

articles.title: Raul Castro ratifica apoyo a la lucha justa del pueblo coreano
articles.content:
Raul Castro ratifica apoyo a la lucha justa del pueblo coreano
Pyongyang, 23 de junio (ACNC) -- El Presidente de los Consejos de Estado y de Ministros de la Republica de Cuba, Raul Castro Ruz, se reunio el dia 14 con el embajador coreano en el Peru, Kim Hak Chol, quien presidio la delegacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea a la Cumbre del G-77 abierta en Bolivia.
					  En la ocasion, Raul dijo que el partido, el gobierno y el pueblo de Cuba estan agradecidos del partido, el gobierno y el pueblo coreanos que apoyan y se solidarizan invariablemente con la Revolucion Cubana.
					
					  Continuo que el pueblo cubano apoyara y respaldara, al igual que en el pasado, la lucha justa del pueblo coreano.
					
					  Expreso el deseo de que el jefe de la delegacion coreana transmita al pueblo coreano el saludo cordial del pueblo cubano.

articles.title: Tiene lugar acto de condena de obreros y gremiales
articles.content:
Tiene lugar acto de condena de obreros y gremiales
Pyongyang, 23 de junio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de lucha antiyanqui-25 de junio, tuvo lugar el dia 23 en el patio de educacion frente al Pabellon Central de Educacion Clasista el acto de condena de los obreros y miembros de la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea. 
					Presento el informe de la ocasion el presidente del Comite Central de la FGSC, Hyon Sang Ju, y hubo discursos. 
					
					Los oradores mencionaron que el 25 de junio del 39 (1950) de la Era Juche, el imperialismo norteamericano, enemigo jurado del pueblo coreano, provoco la guerra de agresion contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea e impuso indecibles desgracias y sufrimientos a la nacion coreana. 
					
					Bajo la sabia direccion del Generalisimo Kim Il Sung, el ejercito y pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea defendieron honrosamente la soberania nacional y las conquistas de la revolucion abriendo por primera vez en la historia el tiempo de decadencia del imperialismo norteamericano, apuntaron. 
					
					Revelaron que los invasores norteamericanos mantienen su presencia en el Sur de Corea causando intolerables sufrimientos y desgracias a la nacion coreana, lejos de sacar la leccion merecida en su derrota vergonzosa sufrida en la pasada guerra coreana. 
					
					Llamaron a demostrar el impetu heroico de la clase obrera de la Corea del Songun en reunificar la patria y lograr la victoria final de la causa revolucionaria del Juche, en acato a la orientacion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					Participaron en el acto los funcionarios y miembros de la FGSC y los obreros.

articles.title: Tiene lugar recital de canciones de venganza de funcionarias e integrantes de UMDC
articles.content:
Tiene lugar recital de canciones de venganza de funcionarias e integrantes de UMDC 
Sinchon, 23 de junio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de lucha antiyanqui-25 de junio, tuvo lugar el dia 23 en Pamnamugol de la comuna de Wonam del distrito de Sinchon de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur el recital de canciones de venganza "!Castigo duro al imperialismo norteamericano!" de las funcionarias y miembros de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea. 
					En el solo "Mi pais hermoso" y la poesia "25 de junio", los ejecutantes condenaron categoricamente los crimenes de bestias yanquis, enemigos jurados que hace varios decenios, provocaron la guerra para arrebatar la cuna de vida del pueblo coreano. 
					
					El solo "El amor a mi patria, el odio a los enemigos" y el coro "Nuestra bayoneta garantiza la paz" hacen sentir una vez mas la verdad de que no se debe tratar con piedad a los enemigos de clase y la paz se defiende solo con armas del Songun. 
					
					En el coro "No sabemos a nadie sino a Usted" los ejecutantes demostraron bien la gran fidelidad y el fervor revolucionario del pueblo coreano decidido a adelantar la victoria final uniendose compactamente en torno al Mariscal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					Participaron en el acto la presidenta del Comite Central de la UMDC, Kim Jong Sun, el secretario del Comite del Partido del Trabajo de Corea en la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, Pak Thae Sop, los funcionarios correspondientes y las miembros de la UMDC en el distrito de Sinchon.
